meanings.definition: The act of repealing or abolishing a law, agreement, or custom.
meanings.sent1: The abrogations of outdated laws helped modernize the legal system.
meanings.sent2: The government's abrogations of unfair agreements were met with relief by the citizens.
meanings.sent3: The abrogations of silly rules made everyone laugh at how unnecessary they were.
meanings.sent4: Her abrogations of toxic relationships were like removing weights from her shoulders.
meanings.sent5: The abrogations of unjust regulations made the community feel liberated.

meanings.definition: The act of officially ending or cancelling something.
meanings.sent1: The abrogations of the event disappointed many attendees.
meanings.sent2: The company's abrogations of the project surprised everyone in the office.
meanings.sent3: The abrogations of the party left everyone wondering what went wrong.
meanings.sent4: His abrogations of promises made him lose trust among his friends.
meanings.sent5: The abrogations of the vacation plans caused chaos among the group.
